snippet: Children in camps and schools across the United States have embraced a fast-paced game called gaga, which is played in a “pit” and resembles dodge ball.
abstract: Children in camps and schools across the United States have embraced a fast-paced game called gaga, which is played in a pit and resembles dodge ball; game, believed to have originated in Israel, has been a standby at Jewish summer camps and community centers for decades before going mainstream.
lead_paragraph: Children in camps and schools across the United States have embraced a fast-paced game called gaga, which is played in a “pit” and resembles dodge ball.

headline.seo: Gaga Playground Game Is Popular at Camps
headline.main: Jewish Camps Spawn a U.S. Playground Hit
headline.print_headline: Jewish Camps Spawn A U.S. Playground Hit
